author: Odeinoichus
title: Enjoyable Set of Summertime Fun.
review:
Set #30412 Park Picnic: LEGO Friends has had two offerings so far in Polybags for 2020 and while you are stuck in self-isolation they would both make excellent items to pick up from the local grocery store to keep young builders occupied in between working on homework.

Pros:

  • Great looking model.
  • Olivia included as the Mini-Doll.
  • Brand new bird pieces found inside. Two of them.
  • Fun for play.

Cons:

  • LEGO Bicycle is not compatible with Mini-Doll hand placement, LEGO continues to ignore the need for a new bike element for Mini-Dolls.
  • Andrea falls off bench easily.

Overall opinion

This is a great LEGO set from LEGO Friends and I would definitely recommend it. But I do still think LEGO is failing to capitalize on the opportunity to make a new bike piece specifically for Mini-Dolls, the handlebars cannot be held onto here and it is demonstrating unsafe bike riding habits. Of course it is just a toy. Still though, LEGO should be working to make a better element. Overall though I’d still recommend it.

author: StevenTheBrick
title: Park Picnic
review:
3/5

 

Parts are great. Building experience was ok. Playability is meh. Price is good for the stuff in here. A better Olivia polybag.
